title: Class Assignments
text:
Generative art examples with citations.

Naon, Manolo G. (2021). Last Flowers, Yellow. https://www.katevassgalerie.com/print/manolo-gamboa-naon. (September 12, 2022).

Stock, Mark. (2011). Green Flow. http://markjstock.com/#/field/. (September 12, 2022)

Fall Leaf



Graph critique

The graph depicts the number of front-page headlines referencing a specific war. According to the graph there has been a steady decline in war related front-page headlines from WWI to the war in Afghanistan. The graph contains only two colors grey and green the purpose is to draw the readers eye to the front-page headlines for the war in Afghanistan. This does focus the reader's attention on what the author wants them to focus on. The author has numbered 3 of the bars specifying the number of headlines however there is no detailed y-axis which makes it difficult to understand the number of headlines per year for each war. A significant issue is what is measured in the graph. What is not considered is the change in how news is communicated. WWI occurred from 1917-1921 and the way news was distributed was significantly different than it was for the war in Afghanistan from 2000-2018. The graph depicts newspaper headlines but does not consider other forms of news such as websites, television, and radio.

Love, Juliette & Nordland, Rod. Why Afghanistan Became an Invisible War. (2020) https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/03/01/world/asia/afghanistan-invisible-war.html. (September 12, 2022).
